node.title: Video-making app for promoting green electricity
node.excerpt: The World Bank (with Quicksand Design Studio)

children.text: The project is a digital platform for community engagement in communities with either existing mini-grids or intending to adopt grids. The goal was to further learning and awareness about green electricity in North India. Through a simple app, any user could record their story about how the grid changed their life.

My role was to conduct desk and field research, such as writing protocols, visiting users, and interviewing experts. Then ultimately translating research synthesis into a usable product. I worked in a team of 7 people (design researchers, graphic designer, developer, project manager, and movie-maker). I mostly enjoyed observing users and figuring out the structure of the app.

With the question "What is neutrality in India?" as the guideline, we developed a trend report holding informative facts and inspiring answers to orient the designers in the conception of the next phone series for the Indian market in 2018/19.

The team was composed of a creative manager, a graphic designer, and 3 design researchers (including me). In 4 months, we interviewed  20+ experts from the creative field, conducted in-depth user interviews, dived deep into market research, organised inspiring workshops with the clients as well as cultural visits and immersion for them.
